title: Muting 9 players at start of game
body:
Lately I've strongly considered just muting everyone right away.  When on a losing streak especially I just don't want to hear everyone's whining.    Is that a bannable offense or a viable strategy to playing? 

I still ping and respond to pings,  I just don't want to hear the comments.

replies.body:
Perfectly viable.

/mute all

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Tantram,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=cTpht8oh,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2016-12-19T20:57:25.725+0000)
>
> Perfectly viable.
> 
> /mute all

I am going to screenshot this and use it so much.

Thank you for this forum weapon, Lord Riot Tantram sama.
/mute Dominik Destine
:D
well i, like you, am a great muta.
There's only one Keiji Muto.
Lol, there needs to be a feature for multiple upvotes...... On the other hand, DD would probably just upvote everything he says. Nvm

You make me grind my teeth.

Good thing you'll be able to help me with that. :D

What about when they become unmuted in post-game chat? If you got flamed in Round 1 in the game and had to mute someone, Round 2 is coming in post game chat, where you get to watch people ask for your report, since mutes end in post game chat.
WTF is this downvoted for?
People wanna be able to flame.

Add them to your block list with /ignore (or maybe it's /squelch) and they won't be unmuted in the lobby. For a little while they updated the in-game muting to actually block the player, but realized it was too heavy-handed so reverted it. It's always possible they may revisit this as a separate feature for ease of use.

>It's always possible they may revisit this as a separate feature for ease of use.

I'm going to do my part to make sure they do.
Just leave or see what they say. The games done so nothing they say will affect the game

I like to see the stats and usually have to put reports in myself due to things that were said or done, so I have to sit through it.

I shouldn't be bullied or forced to leave because some people want to be abusive.

Muted players should stay muted until you decide to unmute them. Every other game makes mutes permanent.
Just open it in your match history. It's more detailed and in a nicer layout.

I like that it unmutes, so I can see if they were flaming me or not. Then I just make a legitimate report because of it and they move 1 step closer to punishment. Don't take insults personally... nobody plays perfectly every game, and theyd say it to anyone if your team ends up losing. They just wanna blame someone so the other people "know" that it's not their fault. I don't like being flamed during the game just cuz it's a distraction and affects my decision making. After game? Go ahead and pointlessly flame me, because you're only hurting yourself when I report you for it. Just don't take it personal, they don't know you or how well you play on average.

I have actually asked for this for a long time as well. If Riot wants to differentiate between mute and ignoring, at least have it so that they become unmuted in the next game match, and not just ingame.

Could you please make this an ingame tip of the day?

Because, I grow pretty tired of all the uninformed people claiming that it is somehow "reportable" on the boards.
i think most people think its "refuse to communicate " if you mute all you can also miss some important informations  ( flash cooldowns etc altho with the latest pings this problem is not here )

>i think most people think its "refuse to communicate 

Then most people are morons, because

* That is not a report reason, and...

* ...it never was a real report reason, because the "refusing to communicate report didn't do anything, and yes, [this has been confirmed by Riot](http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=828321&page=3#post9792390)
if its not ( i'll use this quote from rioter if needed ) time to make my chat box disappear forever :D
Can we have this as a default setting?{{summoner:11}}

I am making a champion suggestion as a part of my game design portfolio. Can someone please tell me what Riots champion game designers think about making a champion in LoL with similar transparency passive like Mortred from original Dota ( not Dota 2, where Mortred isn't transparent ) ? Or like Ghosts / Dark Templar fluctuations from Starcraft 2?
I am not talking about Stealth or Camouflage, but visual effect that makes champion hard to spot at first sight, but he still can be fought and targeted as a normal champion.

def not a reportable offense, if it was muting other players wouldnt be an option.
as long as you find a way to still communicate with ur team ie. pings your good
it's not a bannable offense. but in my opinion. it should be.
Ha, I'd love to hear the logic on this one.

> [{quoted}](name=RookPusher,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=cTpht8oh,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2016-12-19T21:49:36.131+0000)
>
> Ha, I'd love to hear the logic on this one.

gladly. it's unfair to the players who arent toxic. but become unable to communicate with their team. because everyone in thier elo mutes them before they can even type. if this is the standard for low mmr. they should eliminate chat altogether
But you can ping.
You can't explain the strategy in pings. Also it's not really clear if you're muted or if the person just isn't responding/reading.

Do you honestly think they listen? 

If you ask someone why they're building [ITEM X] they wish cancer on your family. They're not going to listen to you. They read MOBAFire. They're right.

I'm not against muting others if they harass you, I object only against preemptive muting of everyone in the game. Yes, there are many dumb/frustrated/childish.. people in the game who are just venting their problems on others, but there are also many nice people out there. They are just not as vocal.
Same people are outside of your home, so you decide to never go outside and just order everything from the Internet? If you preemptively "shield" yourself from the whole community, you let the toxic minority to win.

It took me awhile to realize this, and I still don't like it, but acknowledge it as fact:

Ranked isn't for fun. It's not for socializing. People are there to do work, climb, and get to at least gold, because that's when Riot stops ****ing them over and giving out free skins for their main they cant otherwise purchase. 

I don't mute people in Normals. I have a ton of fun in normals. But in ranked, you should mute me because I'm going to constantly tell you what the team needs, how we can win, and how we can regroup after screw ups.
Sweet Christmas no it's not bannable. Mute all. Always. Even when you're winning.

Not only is it not a bannable offense, it's highly recommended in cases like this one, where you are worried about having an entire team of flamers.  The game is supposed to be fun.  And if you need to not read people's bs comments to have fun, then /mute them.
It isnt a bannable offence otherwise why would the /mute all function be there? I wish you best of luck in your games.
It will double your win rate

definitely consider to mute the enemy team permanently and to forget that /all chat even exists

mute yours only if things go bad

I do this on my actual accounts I care about. Nothing anyone has to say is worth reading. Just mute all and win more games.
